previous.name: In the Land of the Mallas

segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 48
segments.en: Linked Discourses 48

segments.pli: 6. Sūkarakhatavagga
segments.en: 6. The Boar’s Cave

segments.pli: 53. Sekhasutta
segments.en: 53. A Trainee

segments.pli: Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
segments.en: So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosambiyaṃ viharati ghositārāme.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: “atthi nu kho, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma sekho bhikkhu sekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘sekhosmī’ti pajāneyya, asekho bhikkhu asekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘asekhosmī’ti pajāneyyā”ti?
segments.en: “Mendicants, is there a way that a mendicant who is a trainee, standing at the level of a trainee, can understand that they are a trainee? And that a mendicant who is an adept, standing at the level of an adept, can understand that they are an adept?”

segments.pli: “Bhagavaṃmūlakā no, bhante, dhammā … pe …
segments.en: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. …”

segments.pli: “atthi, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma sekho bhikkhu sekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘sekhosmī’ti pajāneyya, asekho bhikkhu asekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘asekhosmī’ti pajāneyya.
segments.en: “There is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee, standing at the level of a trainee, can understand that they are a trainee, and that a mendicant who is an adept, standing at the level of an adept, can understand that they are an adept.

segments.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma sekho bhikkhu sekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘sekhosmī’ti pajānāti?
segments.en: And what is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ pajānāti—
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant who is a trainee truly understands: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

segments.pli: ayampi kho, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma sekho bhikkhu sekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘sekhosmī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: This is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu iti paṭisañcikkhati:
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant who is a trainee reflects:

segments.pli: ‘atthi nu kho ito bahiddhā añño samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā yo evaṃ bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ tathaṃ dhammaṃ deseti yathā bhagavā’ti?
segments.en: ‘Is there any other ascetic or brahmin elsewhere whose teaching is as true, as real, as accurate as that of the Buddha?’

segments.pli: So evaṃ pajānāti:
segments.en: They understand:

segments.pli: ‘natthi kho ito bahiddhā añño samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā yo evaṃ bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ tathaṃ dhammaṃ deseti yathā bhagavā’ti.
segments.en: ‘There is no other ascetic or brahmin elsewhere whose teaching is as true, as real, as accurate as that of the Buddha.’

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma sekho bhikkhu sekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘sekhosmī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: This too is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, sekho bhikkhu pañcindriyāni pajānāti—
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant who is a trainee understands the five faculties:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ, vīriyindriyaṃ, satindriyaṃ, samādhindriyaṃ, paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Yaṅgatikāni yaṃparamāni yaṃphalāni yaṃpariyosānāni. Na heva kho kāyena phusitvā viharati;
segments.en: And although they don’t have direct meditative experience of their destination, apex, fruit, and culmination,

segments.pli: paññāya ca ativijjha passati.
segments.en: they do see them with penetrating wisdom.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma sekho bhikkhu sekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘sekhosmī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: This too is a way that a mendicant who is a trainee can understand that they are a trainee.

segments.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma asekho bhikkhu asekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘asekhosmī’ti pajānāti?
segments.en: And what is the way that a mendicant who is an adept can understand that they are an adept?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, asekho bhikkhu pañcindriyāni pajānāti—
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant who is an adept understands the five faculties:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ, vīriyindriyaṃ, satindriyaṃ, samādhindriyaṃ, paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Yaṅgatikāni yaṃparamāni yaṃphalāni yaṃpariyosānāni. Kāyena ca phusitvā viharati;
segments.en: They have direct meditative experience of their destination, apex, fruit, and culmination,

segments.pli: paññāya ca ativijjha passati.
segments.en: and they see them with penetrating wisdom.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma asekho bhikkhu asekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘asekhosmī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: This is a way that a mendicant who is an adept can understand that they are an adept.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, asekho bhikkhu cha indriyāni pajānāti.
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant who is an adept understands the six faculties:

segments.pli: ‘Cakkhundriyaṃ, sotindriyaṃ, ghānindriyaṃ, jivhindriyaṃ, kāyindriyaṃ, manindriyaṃ—
segments.en: eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

segments.pli: imāni kho cha indriyāni sabbena sabbaṃ sabbathā sabbaṃ aparisesaṃ nirujjhissanti, aññāni ca cha indriyāni na kuhiñci kismiñci uppajjissantī’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: They understand: ‘These six faculties will totally and utterly cease without anything left over. And no other six faculties will arise anywhere anyhow.’

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, bhikkhave, pariyāyo yaṃ pariyāyaṃ āgamma asekho bhikkhu asekhabhūmiyaṃ ṭhito ‘asekhosmī’ti pajānātī”ti.
segments.en: This too is a way that a mendicant who is an adept can understand that they are an adept.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: How does someone recognize that they are a trainee? By understanding the four noble truths and the five faculties. But only a perfected one fully embodies these qualities.
